_header: In Tiberius time the true emperor
_description: The alliterative Sege of Ierusalem — 1334 lines

BodLauMis656.First Lines:
In tyberyns tyme þe trewe emperourSire sesar hym sulf seysed
                    in rome…
BodLauMis656.Last Lines:
…Wenten syngyng a way & han her wille foryred& hom
                    riden to rome now rede ons oure bord
BodLauMis656.Attributed Title: Hic terminatur bellum Iudaiceum apud Ierusalem (f. 19)
BodLauMis656.Editions:
Steffler,  Gustav,
                        ed.  
             The Sege of Jerusalem: Nach dem Bodl. Ms. Laud F. 22.
         Marburg: Elwertschle, 1891. 
Kölbing,  Eugen,  and  M. Day, eds.  
             The Siege of Jerusalem, from Bodleian MS. Laud Misc. 656.
EETS
         o.s. 188 (1932); repr. 1988. 
Turville-Petre,  Thorlac. 
             Alliterative Poetry of the Later Middle Ages.
Routledge Medieval English Texts.
         Washington: Catholic University of America Press, 1989: 161-9 (lines 521-724).
Livingston,  Michael,
                        ed.  
             Siege of
                    Jerusalem.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2004.

CULMm514.First Lines:
IN tyberius tyme that trewe emperourSire Cesar him self sesed in
                    Rome…
CULMm514.Last Lines:
…Ihesu ioyne hem and vs with ioye in his blisseAnd to wele hem
                    wysse that reden this geste
CULMm514.Attributed Title:
Incipit Destruccio de Jerusalem per Titum & Vespasianum (f.
                    187)

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
yn Tyberyus tyme þe trewe EmperourSyr sesar hym self sesed in
                    rome…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Ihesu Ioye hem & vs with Ioye in his blysseAnd to welthe
                    hem wysse that wryten this geste
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Ends ‘Amen’ at end of last line and ‘Explicit’
                    in lower margin below.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
The Sege of Ierusalem (in upper margin, f. 111, and as RT running across
                    verso-recto thereafter); A poeme the seeg of Ierusalem (f. 1, sixteenth-century
                    list of contents)

BLCottVesEXVI.First Lines: …Ouerloke euery lyne vnto þe last endeBurdes werin borne adowne and þe berin rises…
BLCottVesEXVI.Last Lines: …Wenten singyng away whanne þey her wille haddynAnd home riden to Rome nowe rede vs oure lord…
BLCottVesEXVI.Attributed Title: Destructio Ierusalem per Vispasianum & Titum (by scribe below last line (f. 75v)

BLAdd31042.First Lines: In tyberyus tyme that trewe EmperoureSir Cesare hym seluyn was sessede in Rome…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …Wente syngande awaye and hase thaire wills forthirdeAnd rydis to Rome thare rede vs oure lorde
BLAdd31042.Attributed Title: Hic Incipit Distruccio Ierusalem et vidicarunt mortem domini Ihesu Cristi. The Segge of Ierusalem. Off Tytus and Vaspasyane (f. 50); Explicit la sege de Ierusalem

Lam491.First Lines:
IN tyberies tyme the trewe EmperourSir Cesar hym self sesid in
                    Rome…
Lam491.Last Lines:
…Ihesu Ioyne hem and vs wiþ ioy in his blysseThat wrote
                    þis geest to his wele he hym wisse
Lam491.Attributed Title:
Here bygynnith þe sege of Ierusalem (f. 206, rubric); Þe sege of
                    Ierusalem (RT, rubric); Explicit þe sege of Ierusalem (f. 227v,
                    rubric)

HunHM128.First Lines:
In tyberyes tyme the trewe emperowrSere cesar hym seluen seysyd in
                    rome…
HunHM128.Last Lines:
…Wente synggyng awey & lefte woo thereAnd hool reedyn to
                    rome yblessyd be god almyȝty
HunHM128.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth þe seege of ierusaleem & how it was destroyed (f.
                    205)

PULTayM11.First Lines:
IN Tiberius tyme þe trewe EmperoureWhenne Cesar hym seluyn was
                    cesed in Rome…
PULTayM11.Last Lines:
…ffelled of þe fase [ ]Als bestes b[ ]Þan tit
                    is [ ]Mas mason [ ]After profers þaim [ ]When he [ ]Bot
                    ȝone þe [ ]And [ ]Says [ ]Þan [ ]G[
                    ]Myȝht [ ]ffor [ ]…
PULTayM11.Note:
Ends incomplete at end of volume; last page damaged by
                    damp.
